conclusion: Consider contributions of charges at A, B, and C to electric field and potential at O.
Outline: Charges at A and B, electric field at O is E, potential not given, opposite charge at C.
Determine new electric field and potential at O after placing charge at C.
Points A, B, and C form an equilateral triangle.
Electric field at O due to charges at A and B is E, along axis perpendicular to AB.
Charge -q at C creates electric field at O opposite to resultant from A and B.
Net electric field at O is zero after placing charge at C.
Potential at O due to charges at A and B is 2V.
Potential due to charge -q at C is -V.
Total potential at O is V after placing charge at C.
Final electric field at O is 0, potential is V.
